metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11450 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
coders/jpeg.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.6-1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via JPEG data that is too short.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.8').
